intro: Pedilanthus tithymaloides subsp. jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are clustered in umbels and attract various pollinators. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its often arid habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and traditional uses.
